member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity
member.summary: Represents a SCORM activity.
member.remarks: This class contains all information necessary to represent an activity, including the LearningDataModel. Activities are stored in a tree structure and are a superset of the TableOfContentsElement class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement
member.summary: Represents an element in the Table of Contents

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement.#ctor
member.summary: Internal constructor added so no 3rd parties can extend this class

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement.Title
member.summary: Gets the title for this table of contents element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement.Children
member.summary: Gets the children of this table of contents element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement.IsValidChoiceNavigationDestination
member.summary: Gets whether or not this table of contents element is valid to navigate to via Choice navigation.
member.remarks: This value is only guaranteed valid at the time immediately after the calling of LoadTableOfContents. Changes made to the current activity's data model or navigations performed after this call may change whether or not this element is actually valid to navigate to, but this will not be reflected in this value unless or until LoadTableOfContents is called again.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement.ResourceType
member.summary: Gets the type of the resource associated with this table of contents element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement.ActivityId
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the activity associated with this table of contents element.
member.remarks: Using this identifier within NavigateTo instead of the activity's string identifier will result in improved performance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets whether or not this table of contents element is displayed when the structure of the package is displayed or rendered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement.HasVisibleChildren
member.summary: Gets whether or not this table of contents element has at least one descendant child, any level deep, with a value of true for IsVisible.
member.remarks: This value is used to determine how to display the UI of nodes - whether the node should be displayed as having available children or not.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_owner
member.summary: The Navigator object that owns this activity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_parent
member.summary: The parent of this activity. This is null for the root activity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_next
member.summary: The next sibling activity. This is null for a right-most activity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_previous
member.summary: The previous sibling activity. This is null for a left-most activity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_children
member.summary: A list of the children of this activity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_rawStaticXml
member.summary: An xml block in Static Activity XML format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_dataModel
member.summary: The activity's data model.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_activityId
member.summary: A unique identifier for this activity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_randomPlacement
member.summary: Random placement of this activity within its parent, or -1 if the original placement is to be used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_objectivesGlobalToSystem
member.summary: True if objectives are global to the system for this activity tree. This is only valid for the root activity, it should be ignored for all other activities.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_sequencing
member.summary: Static sequencing data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_isValidToNavigateTo
member.summary: Whether or not this activity is valid to navigate to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_internalActivityId
member.summary: Internal activity id, used for saving data to the database.
Initializes an Activity object.
member.param: The owner of this actitity tree.
The unique identifier of this activity.
Refers to an xml block in Static Activity XML format.
Refers to an xml block in Sequencing Activity XML format.
Refers to an xml block in Dynamic Activity XML format.
Refers to an xml block in LMS Comments XML format.
Delegate to wrap attachments.
Delegate to wrap guids that represent attachments.
Random placement of this activity within its parent, or -1 if the original placement is to be used.
Whether or not objectives are global to the system within this activity tree.
Validation mode to determine if the data model is writable.
The unique identifier of the learner.
The name of the learner.
The language code for the learner.
The AudioCaptioning setting for the learner.
The audio level setting for the learner.
The delivery speed setting for the learner.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.UpdateScore(System.Nullable{System.Single},System.Nullable{System.Single})
member.summary: Updates the total score for the entire activity tree.
member.param: The previous score for this activity.
The new score for this activity.
member.remarks: This method must only be called for SCORM 1.2 or LRM packages. The value passed is intended to be added to the previous value of Navigator.TotalPoints.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.#ctor(Microsoft.LearningComponents.Navigator,System.Int64,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an Activity object for cloning.
member.param: The owner of this actitity tree.
The unique identifier of this activity.
Refers to an xml block in Static Activity XML format.
Refers to an xml block in Sequencing Activity XML format.
Random placement of this activity within its parent, or -1 if the original placement is to be used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.CloneForNavigationTest
member.summary: Clones this activity by copying only the data needed for sequencing/navigation.
member.returns: A new activity with data similar enough for sequencing/navigation purposes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.OnDataModelChanged
member.summary: Called via delegate when the data model changes
member.remarks: This method merely adds this activity to the collection of dirty activities in the Navigator that owns this activity. Later, it is the responsibility of that Navigator to save these dirty activities if the view mode supports saving.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.GetResourceType(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Gets the resource type from the specified navigator
member.param: The navigator that holds the resourceType attribute
member.returns: The resource type
member.remarks: Added to get around the FxCop warning CA2214, which complains about calling a virtual method in a constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.SetValidToNavigateTo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether or not this activity is valid to navigate to.
member.param: Whether or not this activity is valid to navigate to.
member.remarks: We can't just make an internal set for this property because that conflicts with the abstract get accessor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.m_prerequisites
member.summary: The prerequisites for the activity. This value is only valid for SCORM 1.2

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.AddChild(Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity)
member.summary: Adds a child activity to this activity.
member.param: The activity to add as a child.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.RemoveChild(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a child activity at the specified index position.
member.param: The location to remove the child activity from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.CompareActivities(Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement,Microsoft.LearningComponents.TableOfContentsElement)
member.summary: Compares two activites for their position within their parent.
member.param: First activity to compare.
Second activity to compare.
member.returns: Less than 0 if elem1 is less than elem2, 0 if they are equal, greater than 0 if elem1 is greater than elem2.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Activity.SortChildren
member.summary: Sorts children and makes sure their Next/Previous pointers are correct.

member.param: The src attribute value of the img tag that corresponds to the assessment item.
member.returns: The object representing the parsed value.
member.remarks: If more than one of the same name/value pairs exists with the same name, only the first is used.
member.exception: Thrown if the cannot be parsed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.Type
member.summary: Specifies the assessment markup type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.Id
member.summary: Specifies the question (assessment item) number.
member.remarks: All sub-items within a given question must have the same id= value. The id= value can not be longer than 31 characters. The characters are limited to digits (0-9), letters (a-z and A-Z), periods (.), hyphens (-), colons (:), and underscores (_).

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.RenderKey
member.summary: Used by LrmRloHandler during rendering as a dictionary key. It combines the Id and Type to create the key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.Cols
member.summary: Specifies the width in characters of the associated form element.
member.remarks: Depending on the element, this value is used as the value for the cols or size attribute of the HTML element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.Rows
member.summary: Specifies the height (in lines) of the associated form element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.AKey
member.summary: Answer key.
member.remarks: For Text assessment markup, akey= (if provided) specifies an answer key that indicates the correct answer for automatic grading. Semicolons are used to separate multiple correct answers (for example, "akey=color;colour"). Autograding matching is case-insensitive. If one student types "Color" in the previous example, and another student types "colour," both answers will be graded as correct. During grading, if akey= is not provided, the teacher must grade the question manually, either by entering a grade in the space provided by the Item Score assessment markup, or by selecting the appropriate check boxes provided by Rubric assessment markup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.Uak
member.summary: Unordered answer key. If true, student answers may appear in any order.
member.remarks: This argument is used by Text assessment markup to indicate that the student answers may appear in any order (among all sub-items in a question). For example, if the question is "name the three primary colors," and three Text sub-items are provided, one sub-item can have "akey=red", the second can have "akey=green", and the third can have "akey=blue", and all can have Uak == true, which means the student will get full credit for entering "red", "green", and "blue" in the three text boxes in any order.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.MaxPoints
member.summary: Maximum points.
member.remarks: A floating-point number (positive, negative, or zero) that specifies the maximum number of points for an item. maxpts= is used in Item Score assessment markup to indicate the score for a given item. It is also used in Radio, Check Box, and Rubric assessment markup to specify a number of points (positive or negative) for that particular sub-item. The points must be within the range: -1000 <= maxpts >= 1000.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.AssessmentItem.Text
member.summary: For a Select assessment markup, text= specifies the text of one of the lines in the drop-down list box and the correct answer for this sub-item.
member.remarks: For example, if a question has three Select sub-items, with "text=Beta" on the first, "text=Gamma" on the second, and "text=Alpha" on the third, then in Assigned view (that is, while the student is working on the learning resource) each of the three sub-items will appear as a drop-down list box with these four lines: "" (blank), "Alpha", "Beta", and "Gamma" (sorted alphabetically, with "" selected by default).

member.summary: Common strings used during AssessmentItem parsing

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.DataModelListElement.IsInList
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this object is a member of an existing DataModelList.
member.remarks: If this value is true, that means the object cannot be added to any other list.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.DataModelList`1
member.summary: An IList implementation on top of a given XML block.

remarks.para: The caller initializes a DataModelList by passing it XML such as the following:

In this example, if the DataModelList were enumerated, the returned objects would refer to the second-level elements, i.e.<example id="foo"/> and <example id="bar"/>, assuming "example" is used for the elementName parameter of the constructor.
DataModelList optionally checks for uniqueness of a caller-specified attribute, such as "id" in the example above. This is specified using the uniqueIdAttribute parameter of the constructor.
The elementName parameter of the constructor must be in the the default (blank) namespace.
This class is used by LearningDataModel to implement lists such as LearningDataModel.Objectives, LearningDataModel.CommentsFromLearner, etc.

member.typeparam: The type of element in the list. T must support DataModelListElement.

remarks.para: The caller initializes a DataModelList by passing it XML such as the following:

In this example, if the DataModelList were enumerated, the returned objects would refer to the second-level elements, i.e.<example id="foo"/> and <example id="bar"/>, assuming "example" is used for the elementName parameter of the constructor.
DataModelList optionally checks for uniqueness of a caller-specified attribute, such as "id" in the example above. This is specified using the uniqueIdAttribute parameter of the constructor.
The elementName parameter of the constructor must be in the the default (blank) namespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.DataModelExtensionDictionary.ConvertToDataModelExtensionValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a value to one of the types listed in DataModelExtensionType; throws a ArgumentException if the value can't be converted to one of those types. In most cases, the conversion is a no-op -- this method just does validation. In the case of an attachment (a byte[] array), a wrapper for the attachment is returned (see Remarks).

remarks.para: If is one of the primitive data model extension types (string, int, bool, double, DateTime), then that value is returned directly. If a float is passed, it is converted to a double. The only other type supported is byte[] array, and in this case this method will call the LearningDataModel.WrapAttachment delegate to "wrap" the value in an object that implements IAttachment.
This method should only be called when adding a new object is to the dictionary. Otherwise, the exception text may be misleading.

member.param: The object to validate for type
member.returns: The same object, or a wrapper for that object if it is an attachment

member.returns: A value ready to be used by the end user
member.remarks: This method does not do any conversion of any item except for attachments, which are converted from an IAttachment object to a byte array.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel
member.summary: An in-memory representation of the data model associated with one activity of one attempt of one package.

remarks.para: LearningDataModel represents the SCORM RTE data model data associated with one activity. In other words, a LearningDataModel instance represents information related to one learner's execution of one RLO within an attempt of one package.

LearningDataModel exposes the data model on an object derived from LearningSession. An application cannot directly create an instance of LearningDataModel or save the data stored within it. Instead, the application uses the CurrentActivityDataModel property of Microsoft.LearningComponents.Storage.StoredLearningSession to load a data model into memory, and one of various methods of Microsoft.LearningComponents.Storage.StoredLearningSession (such as CommitChanges) to save the data.

An activity's data model includes both read-only and read/write data. Read-only data comes from the package manifest or application and is not set by calls to LearningDataModel. Read/write data can be set the application or the RLO by calls to LearningDataModel. Some read/write data (including some objective information) is initialized from the package manifest but is read/write and can be overwritten by the application or RLO. A data model may also become entirely read-only in certain views (e.g. Review view) or if the data model is not associated with the currently active activity.

remarks.para: All learner data passed is assumed to be in SCORM 2004 format, whether or not this LearningDataModel is to be used for SCORM 1.2 or not. This is how they are stored in the database.
When Navigator performs a navigation operation, it only needs to initialize and , but not , so the latter isn't loaded in that case. contains all data related to an activity that isn't in or .

member.param: The SCORM version, used for validation of values.

Static data, originally derived from the manifest (plus other data not from the manifest, e.g. comments_from_lms, currently in the internal XML format documented in DataModel.doc. This is a "<item>" element. This corresponds to the ActivityPackageItem.DataModelCache column. This may not be null.
Dynamic data, used for sequencing; also an "<item>" element. This corresponds to the ActivityAttemptItem.SequencingDataCache column. This may be null, in which case defaults are used.
Dynamic data which is not used for sequencing; also an "<item>" element. This corresponds to the ActivityAttemptItem.DataModelCache column. This may be null, in which case defaults are used.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the comments from lms data is valid or not. If this value is false, the SetDynamicData method may override any existing data within m_commentsFromLms.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.WrapAttachment
member.summary: Gets the delegate called to wrap a byte[] array with the interfaces required internally for attachments.
member.remarks: This delegate is called when a new attachment (i.e. a byte[] array) is assigned to extension data. A wrapper class must be generated what supports IAttachment. A new Guid should be generated for the attachment at this time in order to be returned from IAttachment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.WrapAttachmentGuid
member.summary: Gets the delegate called to wrap a Guid with the interfaces required internally for attachments.
member.remarks: This delegate is called when there is already an attachment referred to in the existing XML that will initialize the extension data. In this case only the GUID is saved within the xml, and it is up to the wrapper class to be able to read from some source associated with that GUID and create a Stream from it. IAttachment must be supported by the wrapper class returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.DataChange
member.summary: The delegate called when data has been changed.
member.remarks: This delegate, if set, is called every time any data is added, removed, or altered in the data model. The exact information of what was changed is not conveyed, only the fact that a change has occurred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.Format
member.summary: Gets format of the package associated with this data model

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.CommentsFromLearner
member.summary: Gets the list of comments from the learner about the learning experience.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.comments_from_learner.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.comments.
Each activity has the option to store any number of comments from the learner, on a per attempt basis. These comments consist of freeform text and an optional timestamp and location information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.CommentsFromLms
member.summary: Gets the list of comments generated by the LMS intended to be seen by all learners.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.comments_from_lms.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.comments_from_lms.

Similar in structure and concept to the CommentsFromLearner, however these comments are not writable at runtime and are not stored on a per-attempt basis but apply to all attempts on a particular activity.

There is no specific API to set these comments, they must be written to LearningStore directly. Each time an attempt starts on an activity the appropriate rows for this activity are read from LearningStore and this list is populated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.CompletionStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the learner has completed the RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.completion_status.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.

This value indicates whether or not the learner has completed the current RLO. This value may or may not correspond to the value actually set, but may be determined from the ProgressMeasure and/or CompletionThreshold values, as determined by the table in the SCORM 2004 RTE documentation, table "4.2.4.1a: Completion Status Determination".

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if a value not in the CompletionStatus enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.Entry
member.summary: Gets or sets the entry mode for this RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.entry.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.entry.
If this RLO has not yet been accessed, this should be EntryMode.AbInitio. Otherwise, this value is dependant on how previous attempts on this activity were exited.
This value is set automatically as part of the sequencing process, so it should not ever be necessary to set this property manually, although this is permitted.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if a value not in the EntryMode enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.CompletionThreshold
member.summary: Gets the threshold which indicates whether the RLO should be considered complete.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.completion_threshold.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.
This value may be used to determine whether the RLO is considered complete. See the description of CompletionStatus. This value is initialized from the manifest and may not be changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.MasteryScore
member.summary: Gets the threshold which indicates whether the RLO should be considered complete.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this is invalid.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student_data.mastery_score.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.Credit
member.summary: Gets the credit setting for the data model.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.credit.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.credit.
This value defaults to true, and may not be changed at run-time. It may only be changed by altering the Credit column of the appropriate ActivityPackageItem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.Interactions
member.summary: Gets the list of responses to individual questions or tasks.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.

The property represents a collection of individual questions and learner responses to those questions, keyed by a unique string identifier. This data is set by the RLO and returned to the application. Whether or not and how the application uses this information is undefined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.LaunchData
member.summary: Gets the data from the manifest intended to provide an RLO with some initial launch information.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.launch_data.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.launch_data.
This data represents a string stored in the manifest that is passed to the RLO on each new attempt. It may not be written to, and the format of the data is completely freeform.
If the value has not been set before in the manifest, null is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.Learner
member.summary: Gets learner information and learner preferences.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.learner*.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student*.

This object identifies the learner and provides a means to store preferences for that learner. Learner preferences are stored globally and used to initialize these values, and changes made to these values will never affect any other RLO, or any other attempt on the current RLO.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.LessonStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the current student status as determined by the RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this is invalid.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.lesson_status.
See SCORM 1.2 RTE document section 3.4.4.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to, or if this is not a SCORM 1.2 package.
Thrown if a value not in the LessonStatus enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets location information which may be used as a bookmark within a RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.location.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.lesson_location.
A string designed to be opaque to the application, for use only by the RLO. This may be used, for example, as a bookmark to return to a specific location after the RLO has been suspended and resumed.
For SCORM 2004 packages, this string is limited to a length defined by BaseSchemaInternal.ActivityAttemptItem.MaxLocationLength. For SCORM 1.2 packages, this string is limited to 255 characters.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if the string passed is too long.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.MaxTimeAllowed
member.summary: Gets the maximum time allowed for this RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.max_time_allowed.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student_data.max_time_allowed.
This value corresponds to the amount of time the learner is allowed to use an RLO in this attempt. Automatic checking and validation of this limit is not supported by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.Objectives
member.summary: Gets the list of objectives for the activity, used to track RLO defined goals.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.
This property corresponds to a list of objectives, keyed by unique identifer. This list is initialized originally from data in the manifest, but it may be added to or modified at runtime by an RLO.
Objectives contain many indicators to determine whether or not they have been satisfied and have optional scoring information as well.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.ProgressMeasure
member.summary: Gets or sets the measure of the progress the learner has made toward completing the RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.progress_measure.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.
This property represents a measure of the progress made by the learner toward completion of the RLO. Setting this value will affect the value of CompletionStatus.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to or if this is not a SCORM 2004 package.
Thrown if the value passed is less than 0.0 or greater than 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.ScaledPassingScore
member.summary: Gets the scaled score required to master the RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.scaled_passing_score.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.

This property represents the score required to successfully complete the RLO. This value affects the value of SuccessStatus. The value originates in the manifest and must be scaled to a value from -1.0 to 1.0 inclusive.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.Score
member.summary: Gets the score for the data model.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.score.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.score.

Setting the Score.Scaled property will affect the value of SuccessStatus. Also, setting any of these values will alter the corresponding values on the primary objective, as defined within the manifest.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.SuccessStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the learner has mastered the RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.success_status.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.

This value indicates whether or not the learner has succeeded in current RLO. This value may or may not correspond to the value actually set, but may be determined from the Score.Scaled and/or ScaledPassingScore values, as determined by the table in the SCORM 2004 RTE documentation, table "4.2.22.1a: Success Status Determination".

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to or if this is not a SCORM 2004 package.
Thrown if the value passed is not a valid value for the SuccessStatus enumeration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.PrimaryObjective
member.summary: Gets the primary objective associated with this data model

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.SuspendData
member.summary: Gets or sets data used to persist the current RLO state during a suspension.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.suspend_data.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.suspend_data.
A string designed to be opaque to the application, for use only by the RLO. This may be used to store any data necessary to restart the RLO after a suspend operation.
If the value has not been set before being accessed, null is returned.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if the string passed is longer than BaseSchemaInternal.ActivityAttemptItem.MaxSuspendDataLength characters in SCORM 2004 packages, or longer than 4096 characters in SCORM 1.2 packages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.TimeLimitAction
member.summary: Gets the action to take if MaxTimeAllowed is exceeded.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.time_limit_action.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student_data.time_limit_action.
Indicates what the RLO should do upon a timeout. If this value is not specified within the manifest, the default value of TimeLimitAction.ContinueNoMessage is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.TotalTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the sum of all time spent in this RLO prior to the current session.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.total_time.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.total_time.
This value represents the sum total of all the learner's session times (SessionTime) accumulated for prior attempts on this RLO within the context of this learner attempt.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.SessionTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the session time for the current session of the RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.session_time.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.session_time.
This value represents the amount of time spent in the current attempt on the RLO. The RLO is responsible for setting this value, this is never automatically generated.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.EvaluationPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the points assigned by autograding or by the instructor for this activity.
member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if the value passed is infinity or not a number.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.NavigationRequest
member.summary: Gets the navigation request.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to adl.nav.request and cmi.exit.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.exit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.ExtensionData
member.summary: Gets the extension data.

remarks.para: Extension data does not correspond to any SCORM defined variables. It is used to store information on a per activity basis that cannot be stored in SCORM specifc variables.

Only certain types of data are valid within the extension data. These include Boolean, Int32, DateTime, Double, String, and byte[] array. If a Single is passed, this will automatically be converted to a Double.

All keys into this dictionary are unique, and if the same key is used twice it will overwrite the value and possibly the type information associated with that element. SCORM naming conventions are recommended but not required for key (i.e. variable) names.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.ActivityProgressStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the activity progress information is meaningful for the activity.
member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
member.remarks: Always returns false for activities that are not tracked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.ActivityAbsoluteDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the cumulative duration of all attempts on this activity.
member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.ActivityExperiencedDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the cumulative duration of all attempts on this activity.
member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.ActivityAttemptCount
member.summary: Gets the number of attempts on the activity.
member.remarks: Returns the number of attempts on this activity, including the currently active attempt. This number gets incremented each time a new attempt begins on an activity, before it is delivered for execution.
member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.AttemptProgressStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets an indication of whether the attempt progress information is meaningful.
member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
member.remarks:
Always returns false for activities that are not tracked.
When CompletionSetByContent == true, setting this property will have no affect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.AttemptCompletionStatus

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.LearningDataModel.AttemptExperiencedDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of this attempt on this activity.
member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

Internal activity id used when saving attachments to the database.

In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.comments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Comment.CommentText
member.summary: Gets or sets the textual comment itself.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.comments_from_learner.n.comment.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.comments.
Freeform text defined by the RLO, indicating a comment from the learner.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if the string passed is greater than BaseSchemaInternal.CommentFromLearnerItem.MaxCommentLength for SCORM 2004 packages, or greater than 4096 characters for SCORM 1.2 packages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Comment.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the point in the RLO to which the comment applies.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.comments_from_learner.n.location.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.
This property represents an RLO defined location string, perhaps as a bookmark to indicate where the comment belongs. The format of this string is freeform and its use is optional.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to, or if this is a SCORM 1.2 package.
Thrown if the string passed is greater than BaseSchemaInternal.CommentFromLearnerItem.MaxLocationLength

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Comment.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the point in time at which the comment was most recently changed.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.comments_from_learner.n.timestamp.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.
This property indicates when the comment was created or most recently changed.
This field is a string in the same format as the SCORM specification for timestamps. This may be achieved easily within C# by code as shown in the example.

example.para: If the value has not been set before it is accessed, null is returned.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to, or if this is a SCORM 1.2 package.
Thrown if the year is less than 1970 or greater than 2038.
Thrown if the passed string is not in the correct format.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Learner
member.summary: A class representing the learner data for the data model.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.learner*.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student*.

This object identifies the learner and provides a means to store preferences for that learner. Learner preferences are stored globally and used to initialize these values, and changes made to these values will never affect any other activity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Learner.Id
member.summary: Gets an identifier that represents the learner uniquely.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.learner_id.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.student_id.
This property is a unique identifier for the user, defined by MLC. Any properties other than uniqueness are not guaranteed for the contents of the string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Learner.Name
member.summary: Gets the name provided for the learner by the LMS.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.learner_name.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.student_name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Learner.AudioLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the audio level preference of the learner.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.learner_preference.audio_level.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student_preference.audio.

In SCORM 2004, this property is a multiplier value that specifies an intended change in perceived audio volume level relative to an implementation-specific reference level where 1 indicates no change. For example, the value 0 specifies "off", the value of 0.5 represents half volume and a value of 2 indicates double volume.
In SCORM 1.2, any negative number represents audio being "off", 0 indicates no change of status, and a number from 1 to 100 indicates a volume level from softest to loudest.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if the value passed is less than 0.0 for SCORM 2004 packages, or if it is not an integer or is less than -32768 or greater than 100 for SCORM 1.2 packages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Learner.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the learner's preferred language, for those RLO's with multi-language capability.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.learner_preference.language.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student_preference.language.
In SCORM 2004, this value corresponds to a standard language code as per iso-646.
In SCORM 1.2, this value is freeform text, e.g. "English", "French".
In either case, an empty string indicates the use of the default system language.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if the string passed is longet than BaseSchemaInternal.UserItem.MaxLanguageLength for SCORM 2004 packages, or longer than 255 characters for SCORM 1.2 packages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Learner.DeliverySpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the delivery speed preference of the learner.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.learner_preference.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student_preference.speed.

In SCORM 2004, this proeprty represents a multiplier that specifies the learners preferred relative speed of content delivery expressed as a change in speed relative to an implementation-specific reference speed. For example, 2 is twice as fast as the reference speed and 0.5 is one half the reference speed. The default value is 1.
In SCORM 1.2, this is a number from -100 to 100, where -100 is the slowest speed, 0 is no change, and 100 is the fastest speed.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if this valus is less than 0.0 for SCORM 2004 packages, or less than -100 or greater than 100 for SCORM 1.2 packages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Learner.AudioCaptioning
member.summary: Gets or sets whether captioning text corresponding to audio is displayed.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.learner_preference.audio_captioning.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.student_preference.text.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if a value not in the AudioCaptioning enumerator is passed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction
member.summary: A class representing a single interaction for the data model.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.*.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.*.

The interactions data model element defines a set of learner responses that can be passed from the RLO to the application. Interactions are intended to be responses to individual questions or tasks that the RLO developer wants to record. The application has no implied behavior for any data including within the Interaction class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of this interaction.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.id.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.id.
This property represents the unique string identifier for this interaction. This identifier is only required to be unique within the context of this particular data model.
This value must be set prior to this object's insertion into the LearningDataModel.Interactions list.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to or if this interaction is already part of a list.

In SCORM 2004 packages, thrown if the value passed is empty or is a duplicate, or if the string is not a valid URI. In SCORM 1.2 packages, this is thrown if the value passed is empty or if any of the characters in the string are not alphanumeric or - or _.
Thrown if the string passed is longer than BaseSchemaInternal.InteractionItem.MaxInteractionIdFromCmiLength characters in SCORM 2004 packages, or longer than 255 in SCORM 1.2 packages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction.InteractionType
member.summary: Gets or sets which type of interaction this object corresponds to.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.type.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.type.
Indicates the type of interaction that this instance represents and determines how the response should be interpreted.
If this property has not yet been set, null will be returned.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if a value not in the InteractionType enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction.Objectives
member.summary: Gets the list of objectives associated with this interaction.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.type.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.type.
The objectives referred to in this list are merely identifiers and do not contain all the data of an Objective object.

The objective identifiers may or may not correspond to the objective identifiers found in the LearningDataModel.Objectives data model element. Whether or not there is a relationship to the objective identifiers is implementation specific. The RLO may be designed to track this information and relationship.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the point in time at which the interaction was first made available to the learner.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.timespan.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.time.
This property represents the point in time which the interaction was first made available to the learner for interaction and response.
This field is in the same format as the SCORM specification for timestamps. This may be achieved easily within C# by code like the example.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
In SCORM 2004 packages, thrown if the year is less than 1970 or greater than 2038.
Thrown if the passed string is not in the correct format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction.CorrectResponses
member.summary: Gets the list of correct responses associated with this interaction.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.correct_responses.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.correct_responses.

The CorrectResponses collection is a list of correct responses for an interaction. Depending on the type InteractionType of interaction, the number of correct response patterns required to be supported varies. For SCORM 2004, refer to RTE Section 4.2.9.1: Correct Responses Pattern Data Model Element Specifics for more details on each type. For SCORM 1.2, see the description of the cmi.interactions.n.correct_responses.n.pattern data model element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction.Weighting
member.summary: Gets or sets the weight given to the interaction used to compute the value for a score.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.weighting.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.weighting.
This property represents a weight that may be applied to the value of a score for this interaction.
If this value has not been set, null will be returned.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction.LearnerResponse
member.summary: Gets or sets the data generated when a learner responds to the interaction.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.learner_response.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.interactions.n.student_response.
This property represents the data generated by the learner's response to an interaction. The object type and format of the response is dependent upon the InteractionType of this interaction.

If InteractionType is InteractionType.TrueFalse, this value will be returned as a Boolean and is expected to be set as a Boolean. If InteractionType is InteractionType.Numeric, this value will be returned as a Single and is expected to be set as a Single. Otherwise, a string value is returned and expected.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if the value passed is not the correct type.
Thrown if the value is a string and is longer than BaseSchemaInternal.InteractionItem.MaxLearnerResponseStringLength in SCORM 2004 packages, or greater than 255 characters in SCORM 1.2 packages.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Interaction.ExtensionData
member.summary: Gets the extension data.

remarks.para: Extension data does not correspond to any SCORM defined variables. It is used to store information on a per activity basis that cannot be stored in SCORM specifc variables.

Only certain types of data are valid within the extension data. These include Boolean, Int32, DateTime, Double, String, and byte[] array. If a Single is passed, this will automatically be converted to a Double.

All keys into this dictionary are unique, and if the same key is used twice it will overwrite the value and possibly the type information associated with that element. SCORM naming conventions are recommended but not required for key (i.e. variable) names.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of this objective.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.id.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.id.
This property represents a identifier for the objective, which is required to be unique within the context of this RLO.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

Thrown if the string passed is a duplicate value, or in SCORM 2004 packages, thrown if the value passed is empty, or if the string is not a valid URI. In SCORM 1.2 packages, this is thrown if any of the characters in the string are not alphanumeric or - or _.
Thrown if the string passed is longer than BaseSchemaInternal.AttemptObjectiveItem.MaxKeyLength characters in SCORM 2004 packages, or longer than 255 in SCORM 1.2 packages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.IsPrimaryObjective
member.summary: Gets whether or not the objective is the primary objective for this activity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.Score
member.summary: Gets the score for the objective.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.score.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.score.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.SuccessStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets an indication of whether the learner has mastered the objective.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.success_status.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.
This property indicates whether or not the learner has mastered the objective. How the RLO determines this status is implementation dependent.
This value will default to SuccessStatus.Unknown if not explicitly set by the RLO.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if a value not in the SuccessStatus enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.CompletionStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets an indication of whether the learner has completed the objective.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.completion_status.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.
This value will default to CompletionStatus.Unknown if not explicitly set by the RLO.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if a value not in the CompletionStatus enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of this objective.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this is invalid.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.status.
The status of the RLO's objective obtained by the student after each attempt to master the RLO's objective.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to or if this is a SCORM 2004 package.
Thrown if a value not in the LessonStatus enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.ProgressMeasure
member.summary: Gets or sets the measure of the progress the learner has made toward completing the objective.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.progress_measure.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.
This property represents a measure of the progress of that the learner has made toward completion of the RLO expressed as a number from 0.0 to 1.0.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if the value being assigned is outside the range 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of the objective.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.objectives.n.description.
In SCORM 1.2, this is invalid.
If the value has not been set before it is accessed, null is returned.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to or if this is a SCORM 1.2 package.
Thrown if the string passed is longer than BaseSchemaInternal.AttemptObjectiveItem.MaxDescriptionLength

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Objective.ExtensionData
member.summary: Gets the extension data.

remarks.para: Extension data does not correspond to any SCORM defined variables. It is used to store information on a per activity basis that cannot be stored in SCORM specifc variables.

Only certain types of data are valid within the extension data. These include Boolean, Int32, DateTime, Double, String, and byte[] array. If a Single is passed, this will automatically be converted to a Double.

All keys into this dictionary are unique, and if the same key is used twice it will overwrite the value and possibly the type information associated with that element. SCORM naming conventions are recommended but not required for key (i.e. variable) names.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Score.Scaled
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaled score value of the parent object.

remarks.para: This property is a number that reflects the performance of the learner. The value is scaled to fit the range 1.0 to 1.0 inclusive.
If this value has not yet been set, null is returned.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to or if this is a SCORM 1.2 package.
Thrown if the value being assigned is outside the range -1.0 to 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.Score.Raw
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw score value of the parent object.

remarks.para: This property is used to store a raw, non-scaled score. This value should lie between the Minimum and Maximum values, however since these are optional properties no validation is performed against them.
If this value has not yet been set, null is returned.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
If this is a SCORM 1.2 package, thrown if the value being assigned is outside the range 0 to 100.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.NavigationRequest
member.summary: Represents an exit status and/or a request for navigation made by the RLO.

remarks.para: This class is intended for use by RLO's, not by controlling applications. It provides a method to identify what their status was when they were exited and what they would prefer the next navigation to be. Controlling applications may simply call the desired navigation commands directly.
The entire contents of this class is ignored in all cases except when ProcessDataModelNavigation is explicitly called on the Session object.

When ProcessDataModelNavigation is called, the ExitMode property is checked first. If this value is set to ExitMode.TimeOut, a navigation request of NavigationCommand.ExitAll is performed. If the value is set to ExitMode.Logout, a navigation request of NavigationCommand.SuspendAll is performed. Otherwise, the navigation from Command is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.NavigationRequest.m_dataModel
member.summary: The data model associated with this object

member.summary: An XPathNavigator that points to a <navigationRequest> element.

member.summary: Initializes a new NavigationRequest object.
member.param: The data model associated with this navigationRequest.
An XPathNavigator that points to a <navigationRequest> element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.NavigationRequest.Navigator
member.summary: Gets the XPathNavigator that points to a <navigationRequest> element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.NavigationRequest.Command
member.summary: Gets or sets the navigation command requested by the RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this is a superset of the values allowed by the adl.nav.request command.
In SCORM 1.2, there is no corresponding command.
In the case of a call to ProcessDataModelNavigation() on the Session object, this navigation will be attempted automatically. In any other case, this field is ignored.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to or if this is a SCORM 1.2 package.
Thrown if a value not in the NavigationCommand enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.NavigationRequest.ExitMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the exit status of the RLO.

remarks.para: In SCORM 2004, this corresponds to cmi.exit.
In SCORM 1.2, this corresponds to cmi.core.exit.
In the case of a call to ProcessDataModelNavigation() on the Session object, this may cause a navigation to occur, and may change some initial state in subsequent returns to this RLO.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to.
Thrown if a value not in the ExitMode enumerator is passed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.DataModel.NavigationRequest.Destination
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination of a choice navigation.

remarks.para: If Command is NavigationCommand.Choice, this property represents the unique identifier of the activity that the navigation should move to.
If Command is not NavigationCommand.Choice, this property is ignored.

member.exception: Thrown if this LearningDataModel object cannot be written to or if this is a SCORM 1.2 package.
Thrown if the string passed is longer than BaseSchemaInternal.ActivityPackageItem.MaxActivityIdFromManifestLength characters
