member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession
member.summary: Represents a user interaction with a SCORM package. Subclasses represent sessions that are stored in LearningStore (StoredLearningSession), and those that are in-memory only representations (UnstoredLearningSession).
member.remarks:
TODO: Concepts to define
Exit
Terminate
Suspend
Abandon
Active session
Current activity
Root activity
Session status (or Attempt status)
Attempt -- Does this need to be defined?
View
A description of the views of LearningSession:
Execute view (SessionView.Execute): Represents a view of a learner interacting (attempting) a course. All navigation rules are processed in this view. Committed data is stored in LearningStore. Data persists between instances of LearningSession.
Review view (SessionView.Review): Represents a view of a previously executed session, without regard to navigation rules. Allows accessing any activity that contains a resource. The session does not need to be ended in order to review it. Data of the executed session was previously stored in LearningStore and this view allows viewing it. It does not allow modifying any of the stored data.
Random access view (SessionView.RandomAccess): During random access, the application can access any activity in any order, primarily for the purpose of reading and/or updating the SCORM Data Model for that activity, without regard to SCORM Sequencing and Navigation rules. Allows accessing any activity in the activity tree of the content being executed. The attempt does not have to be ended to view a session in this way. Activities without associated resources may be modified in this view. Committed data is stored in LearningStore. Data persists between instances of LearningSession. When changes are committed, RandomAccessView saves the data model changes, not any global information. It will also not save any changes made to the CurrentActivity or other attempt level data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.#ctor(Microsoft.LearningComponents.SessionView)
member.summary: Constructor to create the LearningSession. This is internal, as only MLC subclasses can create one.
member.param: The view of the session, for example Review, Execute, RandomAccess.
member.remarks:
Constructor is internal. Don't allow classes outside of our product to create one.
Subclass constructors MUST assign a value to m_navigator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.ValidateSessionViewValue(Microsoft.LearningComponents.SessionView)
member.summary: Returns false if the value is not a valid value for a SessionView.
member.param: A view to validate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.CommitChanges
member.summary: Saves any data of this session that has not been saved. You must call this method to ensure changes are persisted in long-term storage.
member.remarks:
Applications should always call this function after performing any operation that changes the state of the session, such as MoveToNext, MoveToPrevious or Exit.
If there are no changes to save, this method has no effect.
member.exception: Thrown if the state of the session and / or its associated data model are in an inconsistent state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.Exit
member.summary: Immediately exits the session without processing any pending navigation requests.
member.remarks:
The attempt associated with this session must have started and identified an activity for delivery prior to calling this method.
This method does not save changes that result from exiting the session. The application should call CommitChanges after this method and prior to disposing the object to ensure changes are persisted.
All of the activities of the session will be exited and the session will end. None of the postConditionRules for any activity in the session will be evaluated.
No further navigation can be taken on the session. The caller cannot resume the session it has exited. To allow resuming the session, use the Suspend method instead of Exit.
member.exception: Thrown if it is not valid to call this method. Use IsExitValid to anticipate if this exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.Suspend
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the the current session. It may be resumed at a later time.
member.remarks:
This method does not save changes that result from suspending the session. The application should call CommitChanges after this method and prior to disposing the object to ensure changes are persisted.
It may not be valid to call this method based on the state of the session. Call IsSuspendValid before calling this method to determine if this method is likely to succeed.
member.exception: Thrown if the session is not in the appropriate state to be suspended. Use IsSuspendValid to anticipate if this exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.Resume
member.summary: Resumes a suspended session. Once the session has been resumed, it is considered active.
member.remarks:
This method does not save changes that result from resuming the session. The application should call CommitChanges after this method and prior to disposing the object to ensure changes are persisted.
The only time that resuming a session is valid is if the session has been previously suspended. Call IsResumeValid before calling this method to determine if the session is in a state which can be resumed.
member.exception: Thrown if the session is not in the appropriate state to be resumed. Use IsResumeValid to anticipate if this exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.Reactivate(Microsoft.LearningComponents.ReactivateSettings)
member.summary: Reactivate a session that has been completed or abandoned.
member.param: Settings to determine which values, if any, are cleared when the session is reactivated.
member.exception: Thrown if the session is not in the appropriate state to be reactivated. Also thrown if the current View is not RandomAccess.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.Abandon
member.summary: Stops the session by abandoning all activities in the session.
member.remarks:
This method does not save changes that result from abandoning the session. The application should call CommitChanges after this method and prior to disposing the object to ensure changes are persisted.
PostCondition rules are not run after abandoning the session. Any current value of NavigationRequest.ExitMode of LearningDataModel.NavigationRequest will be ignored.
A session that has been abandoned cannot be resumed at a later time.
member.exception: Thrown if the session is in a state which cannot be abandoned. Use IsAbandonValid to anticipate if this exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.Render(Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext)
member.summary: Reads a file from within the package associated with this session and writes it to an HttpResponse.
member.param: The context within which to render the file.
member.remarks:
At a minimum, the caller must set the following properties in the :
RelativePath
Response
On return, the following values in may have been set by the session:
MimeType
FormId, if a default was used.
In addition, the content was rendered into the Response of .
This method will not read and write content that is not contained within the package. For instance, if the entry point for an activity is an absolute URL and the caller passes it as the context.RelativePath, this method will not succeed. It also will not render the package manifest.
member.exception: Thrown if is not provided.

Thrown if context.RelativePath or one of Responseis not provided, or there is no current activity identitified in the session. Also thrown if an Execute session requests to render content when the attempt is not active.
Thrown if the file referenced in context.RelativePath cannot be found, or if the caller requests to render the package manifest.
Thrown if the file refernced in context.RelativePath includes a directory that does not exist in the package.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.ProcessFormData(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Web.HttpPostedFile})
member.summary: Process the data returned from the client.
member.param: The collection of name/value pairs returned from a posted form.
Collection of valid files posted in the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.GetTableOfContents(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the table of contents information for the activity tree of the current session.
member.param: If true, the sequencing rules are evaluated against the current state of the session to determine which activities are available for navigation.
member.returns: The root node of the table of contents.
member.remarks:
Each time GetTableOfCOntents is called, the table of contents may be reloaded from its source. This may be a lengthly operation.
If is true, the results may only be valid until any data is changed in the data model of the session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.GetTableOfContents
member.summary: Gets the table of contents information for the activity tree of the current session, without evaluating the sequencing rules to determine if activities are accessible in the current state of the session.
member.returns: The root node of the table of contents.
member.remarks: Each time GetTableOfCOntents is called, the table of contents may be reloaded from its source. This may be a lengthly operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.GetPackageReader
member.summary: Gets a PackageReader for this session that can read the package associated with the session.
member.returns: The PackageReader for this session.
member.remarks:
This allows the subclasses to ensure the package reader is ready to read package files.
The caller should ensure the returned PackageReader is disposed in a timely manner.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.MoveToNext
member.summary: Moves to the next activity in the session. For UnstoredLearningSession, this is determined by a pre-order traversal of the activity tree and navigation rules as defined in the package manifest are not enforced. For a session that represents an active attempt, this is determined through sequencing rules of the package and the progress of the user through it.
member.remarks:
This method requires a current activity in the session.
In the process of navigation, the current activity may be exited before the navigation command is able to complete. If the navigation command then throws a SequencingException, the state of the session is undefined. The current activity may have changed during this process.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no current activity in the session or if the session is not in a state that allows moving to the next activity.
Thrown if a new activity could not be identified for delivery.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.IsMoveToNextValid
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether or not moving to the next activity is a valid operation.
member.returns: Returns true if MoveToNext() would result in a new active activity in the session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.MoveToPrevious
member.summary: Moves to the previous activity in the session. For UnstoredLearningSession or views of sessions that are not active, this is determined by an in order traversal of the activity tree and navigation rules as defined in the package manifest are not enforced. For a session that represents an active attempt, this is determined through sequencing rules of the package.
member.remarks:
This method requires a current activity in the session.
In the process of navigation, the current activity may be exited before the navigation command is able to complete. If the navigation command then throws a SequencingException, the state of the session is undefined. The current activity may have changed during this process.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no current activity in the session or if the session is not in a state that allows moving to the previous activity.
Thrown if a new activity could not be identified for delivery.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.IsMoveToPreviousValid
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether or not moving to the previous activity is a valid operation.
member.returns: Returns true if MoveToPrevious() would result in a new active activity in the session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.MoveToActivity(System.String)
member.summary: Makes the selected activity the current activity.
member.param: The id from the manifest corresponding to the activity to become the current activity.
member.remarks: In the process of navigation, the current activity may be exited before the navigation command is able to complete. If the navigation command then throws a SequencingException, the state of the session is undefined. The current activity may have changed during this process.
member.exception: Thrown if is null.
Thrown if is an empty string.
Thrown if the cannot become the current activity to restrictions in the sequencing rules of the package.
Thrown if the current state of the session does not allow moving to the selected activity or if the activity does not exist in the package.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.MoveToActivity(System.Int64)
member.summary: Makes the selected activity the current activity, using the unique activity id.
member.param: The unique identifier for the selected activity.
member.remarks:
Whenever possible, use this method, which takes a long value instead of the activity key, as it will improve performance.
In the process of navigation, the current activity may be exited before the navigation command is able to complete. If the navigation command then throws a SequencingException, the state of the session is undefined. The current activity may have changed during this process.
member.exception: Thrown if the cannot become the current activity to restrictions in the sequencing rules of the package.
Thrown if the current state of the session does not allow moving to the selected activity or if the activity does not exist in the package.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.IsMoveToActivityValid(System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether or not moving to the selected activity is a valid operation. The activity is identified by it's unique numerical id.
member.param: The unique numeric identifier of the selected activity.
member.returns: Returns true if moving to the selected activity would result in making that activity become the current activity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.IsMoveToActivityValid(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether or not moving to the selected activity is a valid operation.
member.param: The key that uniquely identifies the activity.
member.returns: Returns true if moving to the selected activity would result in making that activity become the current activity.
member.exception: Thrown if is null.
Thrown if is an empty string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.ProcessNavigationRequests
member.summary: Processes all of the pending navigation requests in the current activity's data model.
member.returns: True if a navigation request was processed as a result of this call.
member.remarks:
After this method, the state of the session and its current activity is determined by the navigation commands (if any) that were set in the LearningDataModel of the current activity prior to calling this method. If there is a navigation request to move to a different activity, or to exit the current activity, this method will trigger that pending navigation request.
Pending navigation requests for activities other than the current activity are ignored.
The LearningSession current activity may change after calling this method. It may have changed due to a pending navigation request in the current activity's data model. It may have changed due to the postConditionRules associated with the activity in the package manifest.
If the activity is being paused, and should be left in a state where it can be resumed, then the caller should set the NavigationRequest.ExitMode value of LearningDataModel.NavigationRequest to Suspend before calling this method.
This method does not save the data model after processing these navigation requests, so it is recommended that the application call CommitChanges after calling this method.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no current activity in the session.
Thrown if the state of the session, such as the current sequencing rules, do not allow processing the requested navigation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.ExitCurrentActivity
member.summary: Immediately exits the current activity without processing any pending navigation requests and without saving any data model values that have not been committed.
member.remarks:
It is recommended the application call CommitChanges after exiting the current activity to ensure changes made by this method are saved.
If the caller wants to be able to resume the current activity at a future time, it should set the NavigationRequest.ExitMode value of LearningDataModel.NavigationRequest to Suspend before calling this method.
In SCORM 2004 Content: This method will process the postConditionRules for the current activity. This may result in another activity becoming the current activity in the session. It may also result in not being able to identify a current activity for the session.
In SCORM 1.2 and LRM Content: This method will exit the current activity and make no effort to identify another activity for delivery.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no current activity in the session.
Thrown if the state of the session, such as the current sequencing rules, do not allow processing the requested navigation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.AbandonCurrentActivity
member.summary: Stops the current activity by abandoning it without saving data and without further processing of navigation rules.
member.remarks:
Pending data model changes and other session changes that result from this method are not saved and should be persisted to long-term storage by calling CommitChanges after this method and prior to disposing the object.
In Scorm 2004 content: PostCondition rules are not run after the activity has been abandoned. Any current value of NavigationRequest.ExitMode of LearningDataModel.NavigationRequest will be ignored, and the AttemptStatus of the attempt on the activity will be set to Abandonded.
In Scorm 2004 content: Once this method is called, the current activity will no longer be active for this session. That is, CurrentActivityIsActive will be false. To continue the session, select an activity to attempt using one of the MoveToActivity methods.
In Scorm 1.2 and LRM content: Once this method is called, there will no longer be a current activity in the session.
member.exception: Thrown if this method is called when there is no current activity in the session.
Thrown if the state of the session, such as the current sequencing rules, do not allow processing the requested navigation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.View
member.summary: Gets the view of the current session.
member.remarks: See the class definition for the meaning of the views.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.TotalPoints
member.summary: Gets a points value for the session.
member.remarks:
The value of this score is determined by the type of content that is being used in the session.
In SCORM 2004 content, this is the same value as the root activity primary objective's normalized measure. As such, in this case, if the value is not null, it will be between -1 and 1 (inclusive).
In SCORM 1.2 content, this is the sum of the raw score for the attempts on each activity in the session.
In LRM content, this is the sum of all LearningDataModel.EvaluationPoints for all activites in the session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.CurrentActivityDataModel
member.summary: Gets the data model associated with the current activity in the session.
member.remarks:
Any changes made to the data model must be saved using the CommitChanges method. If CommitChanges is not called and the session is ended, changes to the data model will be lost.
Initially retrieving the data model could be a long-running task involving database or package file parsing. Subsequent property accesses are fast.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no current activity in the session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.CurrentActivityResourceType
member.summary: Gets the type of resource of the current activity.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no current activity in the session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.CurrentActivityEntryPoint
member.summary: Gets the launching point of the current activity. This may be an absolute Uri, which indicates the resource is not in the package, or a package-relative Uri.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.CurrentActivityResourceXmlBase
member.summary: Gets the xmlbase information for the resource of the currect activity. This uri will be the base uri for any references contained in that resource to other files in the package. The value may be a package-relative or absolute Uri. If the resource does not have an xmlbase value, this property returns null.
member.remarks:
For instance, if a package contains a resource that has the following resources node:
<resources xml:base="TestPackageContent/"> <resource identifier="base1_htm" href="Base1.htm" type="webcontent" adlcp:scormType="sco"> <file href="Base1.htm"></file> </resource> </resources>
then the return value of this property would be a uri containing the relative path "TestPackageContent/". This would indicate that, for instance, the file Base1.htm exists in a package subdirectory named TestPackageContent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.CurrentActivityKey

member.remarks: When possible, use CurrentActivityId to refer to activities, as it will afford better performance.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no current activity in the session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.CurrentActivityId

member.remarks: When possible, use this activity identifier (rather than CurrentActivityKey) to access activity information, as it will provide better performance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LearningSession.Navigator
member.summary: Return the navigator for this session.
member.remarks: It may seem odd that this is internal, not protected. Basically, since Navigator is an internal class, it cannot be returned from a property that is protected. The same reason is actually why this property is here at all -- a protected member variable containing an internal type is not allowed by the compiler.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext
member.summary: Represents a context within which to render a session file.
member.remarks: This class provides minimal validation when properties are set on it. An instance of the RenderContext class is passed to a LearningSession object when LearningSession.Render is called. When the Render method is called, then the values in RenderContext are validated as required at the time the request is made to render and may result in an exception at that time.

This value must be relative to either:
The root of the package.

the EmbeddedUIResourcePath.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.EmbeddedUIResourcePath
member.summary: Gets and sets the path to the folder containing resources for UI elements contained in the dynamically generated content. This is not a path to a file within the content, but rather a path outside the package to resources that are part of the Microsoft Learning Components installation and required to render dynamic views of the content such as LRM content.

remarks.p: This property is ignored by LearningSession.Render unless LearningSession.CurrentActivityResourceType is ResourceType.Lrm.
The value may not be set to null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.OutputStream
member.summary: Gets and sets the stream to when a file will be rendered. This does not need to be set if Response has been set.

remarks.p: The value may not be set to null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.Response
member.summary: Gets the response associated with this context.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.MimeType
member.summary: Gets the mime type of the content written to the output stream.
member.remarks: The value is determined by the MimeTypeMapping. If that collection does not provide an appropriate mapping, a default is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.MimeTypeMapping
member.summary: Gets the mapping between file name extension and mime type. The key is the file name extension (including the initial period), the value is the mime type mapped to that extension.

remarks.p: Entries in the collection are culture-sensitive and case-insensitive.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.IisCompatibilityModeExtensions
member.summary: The collection of extensions for which files will be transmitted in a way that is most compatible with the method used in IIS. This is slower than the normal process of rendering files, but can be used for cases where specific file types do not render correctly.
member.remarks: Entries in this list should contain the period prior to the extension. E.g., ".txt".

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.FormHiddenControls
member.summary: Gets a list of hidden controls to be added in the rendered form. The key in the collection is the control id, the value is the value of the control. If a form is not rendered, this value is ignored.
member.remarks:
The key and value in this collection should be provided in plain text. That is, they should not be html encoded.
Entries in the collection are culture-sensitive and case-sensitive.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.Script
member.summary: Gets or sets Represents JScript source code, i.e. a series of Unicode characters intended to be written into a <script>...</script> block of a rendered HTML file. The script will be placed in such a way that it is run immediately following the page load.
member.remarks:
This script will only be added to pages rendered dynamically as LRM content. Pages that are contained within packages that do not have LearningSession.CurrentActivityResourceType of ResourceType.Lrm will ignore this value.
The value may not be set to null or an empty string.
If the value has not been initialized, null is returned when the property get accessor is called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.ShowCorrectAnswers
member.summary: Get and sets a value indicating whether correct answers should be displayed in the content, if possible. Regardless of this value, answers may only be shown if it is supported in the current activity format for the current LearningSession.View. If not set, answers will not be shown.
member.remarks: This setting only affects content which is dynamically rendered, such as Lrm content, and only in Review and Grading views. In other views and content formats, the setting is ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.RenderContext.ShowReviewerInformation
member.summary: Gets and sets a value indicating whether sections of the content intended for a reviewer of a session (and not the learner) should be displayed in the rendered content. If not set, reviewer information will not be shown.
member.remarks: This setting only affects content which is dynamically rendered, such as Lrm content, and only in Review and Grading views. In other views and content formats, the setting is ignored.

member.summary: Process data returned from a form generated by an instance of this class. Also sets the data model's evaluation points field to the total points, computed from the autograding or teacher grading.
member.param: The context within which to process the form data.
The collection of information from the form that should be processed.
Collection of valid files, posted from the request. This may be a subset of the files included in the request, as some posted files may have been removed by the application as invalid.

remarks.p: Data that does not correspond to expected information is ignored.

member.exception: Thrown if posted data contains invalid data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.LrmRloHandler.Render(Microsoft.LearningComponents.RloRenderContext)
member.summary: Render the requested view into the output stream.
member.param: The context within which to render the page.
member.remarks:
When this method returns the OutputStream will contain the rendered file.
The following methods and properties must be return valid values from the :
EmbeddedUiResourcePath, must be non-null
FormElementId
GetInputStream
OutputStream
View
Additionally, if the following properties are set, they will be used:
FormElementAction
HiddenControls
ScriptToRender
All other properties on are ignored.
member.exception: The requested file attachment can't be found.

member.param: The portion of the path to the file after the "/~RLO" portion.
member.exception: The requested file attachment can't be found.

member.name: F:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.Helper.PrerequisitesParser.s_regexPrerequisites
member.summary: This regex matches identifiers, where identifiers start with a letter or underscore and are followed by any characters other than those reserved to be "tokens." "Tokens" are the characters &, |, ~, =, <>, {, }, (, ), *, whitespace, a number that begins a word, and the comma character.
member.remarks: The technical SCORM definition of an identifier is more restrictive than what it matched by this expression. However, since the identifier must also match an item identifier in the manifest, it isn't worth the overhead to ensure the legality of the characters used in the identifiers.

member.remarks: If the script expression is null or String.Empty, this method always returns true.
member.param: The original string value of the script contained in the <adlcp:prerequisites> element.

member.remarks: An implementation of this delegate should handle the case where a LessonStatus is requested for an identifier that does not exist. One solution would to be to return LessonStatus.NotAttempted in that case. Another solution would be to throw an exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader
member.summary: This is a reader of information contained in the manifest in a SCORM package. The package may be 1.2 or 2004 (1.3) version. The package may not be an LRM.
member.remarks:
Most of the methods on this class follow the terminology of SCORM 2004. Unless otherwise noted, they are valid for both 1.2 and 2004 content.
The reading of information in the manifest is lazy. When an object is created, the data for the object to be read is not parsed. When a property value is requested, that property is read from the XPathNavigator.
Exceptions are only thrown if there's no log and reasonable behavior is not possible.
There is an option to add errors and warnings to a log provided by the application. If there is a serious error (and exceptions should be thrown), then the exception is thrown.
When a list is accessed, the list is created but the elements in the list are only created when they are needed.
If PackageValidatorSettings.ScormRequirementValidation=ValidationBehavior.LogWarning or PackageValidatorSettings.ScormRequirementValidation=ValidationBehavior.LogError is set, then exceptions are avoided whenever a reasonable default is possible. For instance, if an element required by the SCORM spec does not exist in the manifest, String.Empty or some other possible valid value is returned.

member.summary: Create a ManifestReader from an XPathNavigator, using the supplied settings.
member.param: The PackageReader to use when MetadataNodeReader requires files outside of the manifest.
The ManifestReaderSettings to use when parsing the manifest. Cannot be null.
The PackageValidatorSettings to use when parsing the manifest. Cannot be null.
Write message that 'x was replaced by y' when the ManifestReaderSettings indicate to fix a value.
The log in which to write error and warning log entries. Cannot be null if a ValidationBehavior.LogWarning or ValidationBehavior.LogError is chosen for one of the settings in
The XPathNavigator, pointing to the <manifest> node.

member.param: The PackageReader to use when MetadataNodeReader requires files outside of the manifest.

Write message that 'x was replaced by y' when the ManifestReaderSettings indicate to fix a value.
If provided, errors and warnings encountered when reading from the manifest are added to the log. See the ValidationResults class for information about errors and warnings.
member.returns: ManifestReader.
member.exception: is null.
There is no valid manifest..
An error was encountered in the XML data.

member.remarks: Although this is a SCORM required attribute, if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true is set, a default value of MANIFEST will be returned if the attribute is missing.

member.summary: The PackageFormat of the package, which identifies whether this is a SCORM 2004, SCORM 1.2, or LRM package.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the package format cannot be determined. A default is not assumed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.Version
member.summary: Corresponds to the version attribute of the <manifest> node, which is an optional attribute used to distinguish between manifests with the same identifier.
member.remarks: Returns String.Empty if it doesn't exist. The SPM is 20. A length longer than that is a violation of SCORM recommendations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.PackageType
member.summary: Returns the type of SCORM package. Currently, it is either a resource package or a content organization package.
member.remarks: If the manifest does not have any organization nodes, it is assumed to be a ResourcePackage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.XmlBase
member.summary: Return the xml:base attribute of the manifest, if it exists.
member.remarks: Returns null if the xml:base attribute of the manifest does not exist.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.ResourcesXmlBase
member.summary: The xml:base attribute, resolved with the manifest's xml:base attribute, of the resources node, if it exists. Otherwise returns null.

remarks.para: If the attribute is provided in the manifest but is not valid and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true was set for this object, an empty Uri is returned.

Example: if the <manifest> has xml:base="http://foo/" and the <resources> has xml:base="bar/", this returns "http://foo/bar/". If the <resources> has xml:base="http://bar/", this returns "http://bar/" regardless of the <manifest> xml:base value. If the <resources> has no xml:base, this returns the <manifest> xml:base, in this case, "http://foo/".

member.exception: The provided attribute is not valid, or there are more than one <resources> node, and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false was set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.Metadata
member.summary: Return a reader of the package level metadata.
member.exception: If the <metadata> node is not provided in a SCORM 2004 package, or if the <location> element of the metadata refers to a file in the package that can not be found, and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false was set.
member.remarks: The <metadata> node is required in SCORM 2004. It is optional in SCORM 1.2.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.Organizations
member.summary: Return a read-only list of organizations (OrganizationNodeReader) in the package.

remarks.para: The order of organziation nodes in this collection is the same as the order in the manifest.

Although SCORM mandates that no two organization nodes may have the same identifier in a manifest, there is not check for that when building this collection. It is up to the application to handle if multiple organizations have identical identifier attributes.

This collection is not populated until methods or properties on it are called. If during population, an organization node is encountered lacking an identifier, a warning will be added to the log if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true is set, or an error will be added to the log and an InvalidPackageException thrown if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set.
The absence of <organization> nodes implies this is a Resource package, instead of a Content Aggregation package.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.DefaultOrganization
member.summary:
The default organization that will be used, unless another is specified when attempting the package. This will return null content that does not include any organizations.
If there is an error in the default organization identifier, the first organization will be returned when ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true is set.
member.remarks: The default organization for SCORM 1.2 content is the first organization node found in the manifest.
member.exception: ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set, and the <organizations> default attribute is invalid if this is a Content Aggregation package, or the default attribute exists if this is a Resource package, or the identifier for the default organization doesn't exist in the manifest.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.Resources
member.summary: Return a list of resources contained in the package. The dictionary has the resource id as the key, the ResourceNodeReader as the value.
member.remarks:
In a SCORM package, the ids of each element must be unique. If the manifest being read violates this requirement and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set, the collection of resources will throw an InvalidPackageException when the error is encountered. If ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true is set, only the first resource of a duplicated ID will be contained in the list.
SCORM states there must be resources in a valid manifest. However, this method simply returns an empty dictionary in this case. It is up to the application to determine what to do if this happens.
member.exception: There are multiple <resources> nodes and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.DecendantSubmanifests
member.summary: Returns a list of the decendant submanifest nodes (all manifest nodes beneath this one - not just the immediate children).
member.remarks: Called by ActivityNodeReader.ParseIdentifierref.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.ManifestSettings
member.summary: Get the ManifestReaderSettings for this manifest.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.ValidatorSettings
member.summary: Get the PackageValidatorSettings for this manifest.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader.SequencingCollection
member.summary: Return the sequencing collection information in the manifest. This is only valid in SCORM 2004 content, so in SCORM 1.2 content, this collection will always be empty. The key is the <sequencing>/ID and the value is a SequencingNodeReader.
member.remarks:
This collection only returns <sequencing> nodes from the <imsss:sequencingCollection>. These all contain ID attributes that are referenced by the IDRef attribute of <imsss:sequencing> nodes inside an <item> node.
Because the nodes are parsed as they are accessed, and not before, errors or warnings can occur when the collection's Count property or MoveNext method is accessed. E.g. if a <sequencing> node contains no valid ID attribute, in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true a warning is put into the log and that <sequencing> node is skipped. In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, an error is put into the log and an InvalidPackageException is thrown.
<imsss:sequencingCollection> is only allowed on Content Aggregation packages, and not on Resources packages. If PackageType is PackageType.Resource and there is a <imsss:sequencingCollection> node in the manifest, then if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true is set, the SequencingCollection is returned anyway. However, if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set, an exception is thrown.
member.exception: If PackageType is PackageType.Resource and there is a <imsss:sequencingCollection> node in the manifest, and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingNodeReader
member.summary: Parses SCORM <imsss:sequencing> nodes.

remarks.para: The <imsss:sequencing> nodes are from a SCORM manifest or the SequencingDataCache field in the ActivityAttemptItem table.
AuxiliaryResources are not available here because they are not recommended for use in 2004.

<imsss:sequencing> nodes occur 0 or more times in <item> and <imsss:sequencingCollection> nodes. In <imsss:sequencingCollection>'s, the <imsss:sequencing> nodes must have an ID attribute, which is referenced by the IDRef attribute of a <imsss:sequencing> in an <item> node.

When used to import a package, a ManifestReader is provided in the constructor, allowing the <sequencing>/IDRef to be resolved. No IDRef values are imported into the database. Only the node corresponding to the reference is imported, in-place.
By implication, this object can only be created for SCORM 2004 content, since the sequencing nodes do not exist in previous SCORM versions.

Holds lists of <imsss:rollupRule> <imsss:preConditionRule>, <imsss:exitConditionRule>, and <imsss:postConditionRule> nodes, and a dictionary of <imsss:objective> nodes (including <primaryObjective> nodes, all in the same dictionary.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingNodeReader.Create(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader,Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ActivityNodeReader)
member.summary: Creates a SequencingNodeReader for the requested node.
member.remarks:
This is used when the sequencing node may have an IDRef attribute that needs to be cross-referenced with the SequencingNodeReader collection held by the ManifestReader. Instead of creating a new SequencingNodeReader, in the case where the IDRef attribute exists, the SequencingNodeReader in the ManifestReader.SequencingCollection that has the matching ID attribute is returned.
If this sequencing node has an IDRef attribute, but no sequencing node with a matching ID can be found, null is returned if parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, and an InvalidPackageException is thrown if parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false.
member.param: A <sequencing> node held inside an item or organization. E.g. not one from a <sequencingCollection>.
The ManifestReader that contains the manifest that holds this <sequencing> node.
The ActivityNodeReader that contains this <sequencing< node.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingNodeReader.Create(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ManifestReader)
member.summary: Creates a SequencingNodeReader for the requested node.
member.remarks:
This is used when the sequencing node may have an IDRef attribute that needs to be cross-referenced with the SequencingNodeReader collection held by the ManifestReader. Instead of creating a new SequencingNodeReader, in the case where the IDRef attribute exists, the SequencingNodeReader in the ManifestReader.SequencingCollection that has the matching ID attribute is returned.
If this sequencing node has an IDRef attribute, but no sequencing node with a matching ID can be found, null is returned if parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, and an InvalidPackageException is thrown if parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false.
member.param: A <sequencing> node held inside an item or organization. E.g. not one from a <sequencingCollection>.
The ManifestReader that contains the manifest that holds this <sequencing> node.

member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Points to an <imsss:sequencing> node and its contents.
The ManifestReader that contains this <sequencing< node. Can be null.
The ActivityNodeReader that contains this <sequencing< node.
The ManifestReaderSettings to use when parsing the manifest. Cannot be null.
The PackageValidatorSettings to use when parsing the manifest. Cannot be null.
Log for warnings/errors.
Write message that 'x was replaced by y' when the ManifestReaderSettings indicate to fix a value.
member.remarks:
This constructor is designed to read the sequencing node XML stored in the SequencingDataCache field in the ActivityAttemptItem table of LearningStore. This allows creating a SequencingNodeReader without requiring a ManifestReader. A ManifestReader is only required for <sequence> nodes that contain the IDRef attribute, since this references a <sequence> node under the <manifest>/<sequenceCollection%gt; node. When using this constructor, the <sequence> node is guaranteed not to contain the IDRef attribute.
This constructor verifies the first node in is a <sequencing> node in the http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imsss namespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingNodeReader.CreateNavigator
member.summary: Return the XPathNavigator for this resource.
member.remarks:
This allows an application to get custom namespaced data (e.g. "foo:bar") from the XML.
Note that because SCORM allows a <sequencing> node that has an IDRef attribute and is not in a <sequencingCollection> refer to a <sequencing> node that has an ID attribute (equal to the IDRef of the previously mentioned <sequencing>) and is in a <sequencingCollection>, if the <sequencing> node read by this SequencingNodeReader has a valid IDRef attribute, the XML returned in the XPathNavigator of this method contains the synthesis of the node read by this SequencingNodeReader and the node referenced by the IDRef attribute.
Following SCORM's rules, the direct child nodes of the current node take precedence over the direct child nodes of the referenced node.

example.code:
If there is the following:
<sequencingCollection> <sequencing ID="seq1"> <deliveryControls completionSetByContent="true"/> <limitConditions attemptLimit="2"/> </sequencing> </sequencingCollection>
and there is also a <sequencing> node elsewhere such as:
<sequencing IDRef="seq1"> <limitConditions attemptLimit="3"/> </sequencing>
The synthesized XML from CreateNavigator would contain:
<sequencing IDRef="seq1"> <deliveryControls completionSetByContent="true"/> <limitConditions attemptLimit="3"/> </sequencing>
where the <limitConditions> exists in the IDRef node, and takes precedence over the one with the ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingNodeReader.Choice
member.summary: Returns the value of the <imsss:controlMode>/choice attribute.
member.remarks:
The default value is "true". See below for when the default value is returned.
The return value is determined as follows:
If this node has the requested attribute:
If the attribute value is valid, the attribute value is returned.
Otherwise, if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations = true, the default value is returned.
Otherwise, if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations = false, an exception is thrown.
If this node does not have the requested attribute, then if the parent <sequencing> element has an "idref" attribute referring to a <sequencing> node in the manifest's <sequencingCollection>, and that <sequencing> node contains the requested node and attribute:
If the attribute value is valid, the attribute value is returned.
Otherwise, if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations = true, the default value is returned.
Otherwise, if ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations = false, an exception is thrown.
Otherwise, the default value is returned.
member.exception: Parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, and the attribute value is non-boolean.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingNodeReader.PreConditionRules
member.summary: Returns the ReadOnlyCollection<SequencingRuleNodeReader> containing the <imsss:preConditionRules> nodes, of type SequencingRuleNodeReader.
member.remarks:
The ReadOnlyCollection returned from this method is not populated until properties or methods on it are accessed. This means that in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, InvalidPackageException may be thrown if there are invalid nodes in the list (e.g. nodes containing illegal attribute values.)
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, warnings are added to the log and invalid nodes are ignored.
If there are no nodes of the specified type, an empty ReadOnlyCollection is returned.
Note that if this sequencing node has a valid IDRef attribute, if there is no <imsss:sequencingRules> node in this sequencing node, the values inside the <imsss:sequencingRules> node in the sequencing node referenced by IDRef is returned.
member.exception: In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there is an invalid node.

member.remarks:
The IDictionary returned from this method is not populated until properties or methods on it are accessed, e.g. IDictionary.ContainsKey, Keys, or accessing the enumerator. In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, InvalidPackageException will be thrown if there are invalid nodes in the list (e.g. nodes containing illegal attribute values.)
Calling any property or method the first time results in an n-order operation as all nodes are scanned and objects created.
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, warnings are added to the log and invalid nodes are ignored.
If there are no nodes of the specified type, an empty IDictionary is returned.
Note that if this sequencing node has a valid IDRef attribute, if there is no <imsss:objectives> node in this sequencing node, the values inside the <imsss:objectives> node in the sequencing node referenced by IDRef is returned.
In the case of primary objectives, SCORM permits the objectiveID attribute to be absent if there are no <mapInfo> nodes contained within the primary objective. When this happens, the objectiveID will be String.Empty, which will be the index into this IDictionary.
member.exception: In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there is an invalid node, or if there are multiple <imsss:objectives> nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRollupRuleNodeReader.ConditionCombination
member.summary: Respresents the <imsss:rollupRule>/<imsss:rollupConditions>/conditionCombination attribute.
member.remarks:
Default value is SequencingConditionCombination.Any, which is applied if the conditionCombination attribute is missing. If the entire <imsss:rollupConditions> node is missing, the value of SequencingConditionCombination.Any is also returned in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, and a warning issued to the log. In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false this issues an error to the log and an exception is thrown.
If the parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true and there is more than one <imsss:rollupConditions> node, a warning is issued to the log and only the first node is parsed.
member.exception: The parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false and the attribute value is invalid, or there are more than one <imsss:rollupConditions> nodes, or the node is missing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRollupRuleNodeReader.Conditions
member.summary: Returns the ReadOnlyCollection<SequencingRollupConditionNodeReader> containing the <imsss:rollupCondition> nodes inside this <imsss:rollupRule>/<imsss:rollupConditions>.
member.remarks:
The ReadOnlyCollection<SequencingRollupConditionNodeReader> returned from this method is not populated until properties or methods on it are accessed. This means that in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, InvalidPackageException may be thrown if there are invalid <imsss:rollupCondition> nodes in the list (e.g. nodes containing illegal attribute values.)
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, warnings are added to the log and invalid <imsss:rollupCondition> nodes are ignored.
SCORM dictates there should always be exactly one <imsss:rollupConditions> node containing at least one <imsss:rollupCondition> node. However, it is possible this ReadOnlyCollection will contain zero nodes, if none exist in the manifest.
member.exception: In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there is an invalid <imsss:rollupCondition> node, or the <rollupConditions> node does not exist.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRollupRuleNodeReader.Action
member.summary: Respresents the <imsss:rollupRule>/<imsss:rollupAction>/action attribute.
member.remarks:
If the parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true and the <imsss:rollupAction> node has an invalid action attribute, a default action of RollupAction.Satisfied is returned. Note: this is not a SCORM default.
If the parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true and there is more than one <imsss:rollupAction> node, a warning is issued to the log and only the first node is parsed.
member.exception: The parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false and the attribute value is invalid, or there are more than one <imsss:rollupAction> nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingObjectiveNodeReader.Mappings
member.summary: Returns the ReadOnlyCollection<SequencingObjectiveMapNodeReader> containing the <imsss:mapInfo> nodes inside this <imsss:objective> or <imsss:primaryObjective>.
member.remarks:
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, an InvalidPackageException is thrown if there are illegal <imsss:mapInfo> nodes in the list. For instance, if there are more than one <imsss:mapInfo> nodes containing an attribute value of "true" for the "readSatisfiedStatus" attribute, this is in illegal condition.
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, a warning is added to the log and only the first instance of a <imsss:mapInfo> containing a value of "true" for a specific attribute is parsed. Any illegal <imsss:mapInfo> nodes are omitted and ignored.

member.summary: A single rule related to sequencing.
member.remarks:
Corresponds to the <imsss:preConditionRule>, <imsss:exitConditionRule>, and <imsss:postConditionRule> nodes, subnodes <imsss:ruleConditions>, and <imsss:ruleAction> and holds a list of the <imsss:ruleConditions> under the <imsss:ruleConditions> node.
Note that whether this node actually corresponds to a pre, exit, or post condition is information not held in this node. Rather, these nodes are contained as separate lists of pre, exit, and post condition nodes in the SequencingNodeReader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRuleNodeReader.GetRuleConditionsNode
member.summary: Helper function to get the <imsss:ruleConditions> node. Caller should check the Count to make sure there is a node. This method returns with the XPathNodeIterator already selected to the first node, so the caller should *not* call MoveNext().
member.remarks: There should be only one <imsss:ruleConditions> node. If there is more than one, in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, a warning is issued to the log and the first one is returned. In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false an error is issued to the log and an InvalidPackageException is thrown.
member.exception: Thrown in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there are multiple <imsss:ruleCondition> nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRuleNodeReader.Combination
member.summary: Returns the <imsss:ruleConditions>/conditionCombination attribute value.
member.remarks:
There should be only one <imsss:ruleConditions> node. If there is more than one, in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, a warning is issued to the log and the first one is returned. In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false an error is issued to the log and an InvalidPackageException is thrown.
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true if there is an invalid token for the conditionCombination attribute, the default value of SequencingConditionCombination.All is returned.
The default value of SequencingConditionCombination.All is returned in both ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there is no <imsss:ruleConditions> node.
member.exception: Thrown in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there are multiple <imsss:ruleConditions> nodes or if the conditionCombination attribute is an invalid value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRuleNodeReader.Conditions
member.summary: Returns the ReadOnlyCollection<SequencingRuleConditionNodeReader> containing the <imsss:ruleCondition> nodes inside the <imsss:ruleConditions>.
member.remarks:
The ReadOnlyCollection<SequencingRuleConditionNodeReader> returned from this method is not populated until properties or methods on it are accessed. This means that in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, InvalidPackageException may be thrown if there are invalid <imsss:ruleCondition> nodes in the list (e.g. nodes containing illegal attribute values.)
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, warnings are added to the log and invalid <imsss:ruleCondition> nodes are ignored.
If there are no <imsss:ruleCondition> nodes, an empty ReadOnlyCollection<SequencingRuleConditionNodeReader> is returned.
member.exception: In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there is an invalid <imsss:ruleCondition> node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRuleNodeReader.Action
member.summary: Returns the <imsss:ruleAction>/action attribute value, or SequencingRuleAction.NoAction if there is none.
member.remarks:
There should be only one <imsss:ruleAction> node. If there is more than one, in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, a warning is issued to the log and the first one is returned. In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false an error is issued to the log and an InvalidPackageException is thrown.
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true if there is an invalid token for the action attribute, SequencingRuleAction.NoAction is returned.
Only a subset of SequencingRuleAction values are valid for each rule condition type. For <imsss:preConditionRule>, valid SequencingRuleAction values are: Skip, Disabled, HiddenFromChoice, and StopForwardTraversal. For <imsss:exitConditionRule>, the only valid SequencingRuleAction value is: Exit. For <imsss:postConditionRule>, valid SequencingRuleAction values are: ExitParent, ExitAll, Retry, RetryAll, Continue, and Previous.
SequencingRuleAction.NoAction is returned in both ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there is no <imsss:ruleAction> node.
member.exception: Thrown in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there are multiple <imsss:ruleAction> nodes or if the action attribute is an invalid value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRuleConditionNodeReader

member.remarks: Corresponds to the <imsss:ruleCondition> node.

The ManifestReader that contains this <sequencing< node. Can be null.

The ManifestReaderSettings to use when parsing the manifest. Cannot be null.
The PackageValidatorSettings to use when parsing the manifest. Cannot be null.
Write message that 'x was replaced by y' when the ManifestReaderSettings indicate to fix a value.
Where errors and warnings are logged.
member.exception: is null.
does not point to a <imsss:rollupRule2> node.

member.remarks: Default value is String.Empty, which is returned when the attribute is omitted, or when the attribute value is invalid or when the value is not an objective identifier in the surrounding activity.
member.exception: The ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set and the attribute value is invalid, such as a string containing only whitespace, or is not an objective identifier in the surrounding activity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRuleConditionNodeReader.MeasureThreshold
member.summary: Represents the <imsss:ruleCondition>/measureThreshold attribute.
member.remarks: Default value is 0, which is returned when the attribute is omitted, or when the attribute value is invalid and the parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true.
member.exception: The parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false and the attribute value is invalid, such as a non-decimal value outside the range of [-1 to 1].

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRuleConditionNodeReader.Operator
member.summary: Represents the <imsss:ruleCondition>/operator attribute.
member.remarks: Default value is SequencingConditionOperator.NoOp, which is returned when the attribute is omitted, or when the attribute value is invalid and the parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true.
member.exception: The parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false and the attribute value is invalid, e.g. when it is not one of the valid tokens: noOp, not.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.SequencingRuleConditionNodeReader.Condition
member.summary: Represents the <imsss:ruleCondition>/condition attribute.
member.remarks: Default value is SequencingRuleCondition.Always, which is returned when the attribute is omitted, or when the attribute value is invalid and the parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true.
member.exception: The parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false and the attribute value is invalid, e.g. when it is not one of the valid tokens: satisfied, objectiveStatusKnown, objectiveMeasureKnown, objectiveMeasureGreaterThan, objectiveMeasureLessThan, completed, activityProgressKnown, attempted, attemptLimitExceeded, timeLimitExceeded, outsideAvailableTimeRange, always.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ReadOnlyMlcDictionary`1.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor to create empty dictionary.
Read only Mlc dictionary.
member.param: Helper object.
The node that will be searched for items in this dictionary collection.
The xpath expression, relative to of values in the dictionary.
The xpath expression, relative to that will return the key for the associated value in the collection.
The delegate which will be result of the xpath query for an item in the collection and will create the actual instance of the value of the collection.
What to call if the node doesn't have the requested key.
member.remarks:
The dictionary gets built in the constructor.
For instance: collectionNode is the manifest node. childValueXPath = ".//resource" childKeyXpath = "@id" Then, ContainsKey does xpath query: childValueXPath + "[" + childKeyXPath + "=\"{0}\"]" where {0} is parameter to ContainsKey. Keys does xpath query: childValueXPath + "/" childKeyXPath ETC...

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.OrganizationNodeReader.PointsPossible
member.summary: The nominal maximum number of points possible for the organization.
member.remarks:
Returns null if it does not exist in the package or as the default. Must be blank or a valid float value; uses ManifestReaderSettings.FixMlcRequirementViolation and PackageValidatorSettings.MlcRequirementValidation to determine what to do in case of error (e.g. return default value or throw InvalidPackageException.
The value of PointsPossible is contained in the <organization> node's <metadata>.
The PointsPossible value originates from LRM content. When ManifestConverter is used to import LRM content, it creates an <mlc:pointsPossible> node under the organization's <metadata>. Note that this property must be a valid float. However, ManifestConverter enforces a value from 0 - 10000 when converting from an index.xml.

member.summary: If true, the objective information (for instance, the learner's scores) should update the learner's lifetime score for the objective.
member.remarks: Default value is true. If the attribute is invalid (non-bool) and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true is set, return the default value and issue a warning to the log.
member.exception: Attribute is invalid and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.OrganizationNodeReader.Activities
member.summary: List of activities within the organization. This list returns all the top-level activities in the organization. Each of those Activity objects includes its child activities.
member.remarks:
List all list elements, when this property is accessed, the list is populated.
The activity (e.g. <item>) nodes are in this collection in the same order that they are in the manifest file.
<item> nodes that do not have a valid identifier attribute are not included in this list.
Although SCORM mandates that no two item nodes may have the same identifier in a manifest, there is no check for that when building this collection. It is up to the application to handle if multiple items have identical identifier attributes.

member.remarks:

If there are multiple <sequencing> nodes and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true is set, a warning is issued to the log.
member.exception: There are multiple <sequencing> nodes and ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false is set.

member.remarks:

In SCORM 2004 packages, if the activity has a resource and also has child <item> nodes, this property will throw an InvalidPackageException in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false.

member.summary: Returns true if the activity should be visible.
member.remarks:
The default value, if absent, is "true".
If the value of the attribute is non-boolean, and the parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, a warning is put into the log, if provided, and the default value is returned. If the parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, an error is put into the log and an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ActivityNodeReader.ResourceParameters
member.summary: Parameters that should be passed to the resource at run time. If there are no parameters for this resource, the property returns String.Empty.
member.remarks:
The default value, if absent, is String.Empty.
SCORM dictates that this attribute is valid only for items that reference resources. However, in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false this still simply returns String.Empty even when the item does not reference a resource. If the application wishes to be that strict, it can check the Resource property when this returns a non-String.Empty value. If the Resource property returns no resources, the application will know that this attribute value is not technically allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ResourceNodeReader.Files
member.summary: Returns the ReadOnlyCollection<FileNodeReader> containing the <file> nodes within this <resource>.
member.remarks:
The ReadOnlyCollection returned from this method is not populated until properties or methods on it are accessed. This means that in ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false, InvalidPackageException may be thrown if there are invalid nodes in the list (e.g. nodes containing illegal attribute values.)
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, warnings are added to the log and invalid nodes are ignored.
If there are no nodes of the specified type, an empty ReadOnlyCollection is returned.
Note that dependency files are not included in this list. Applications should access the Dependency property to build a full list of files for this resource.
member.exception: In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there is an invalid node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.ResourceNodeReader.Dependencies
member.summary: Returns the ReadOnlyCollection<ResourceNodeReader> containing the resources this resource is dependent upon.

remarks.para: To build this list, the identifierref attributes on the <dependency> nodes inside this <resource> node are cross-referenced with the identifier attributes on the <resource> nodes within this manifest.
The ReadOnlyCollection returned from this property is populated upon calling this property. E.g. non-trivial processing time is required.
In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, warnings are added to the log and invalid nodes are ignored.
If there are no nodes of the specified type, an empty ReadOnlyCollection is returned.

Note that this only includes dependencies that are one layer deep. E.g. if resource A has resource B as a dependency, resource B is included in the list of dependencies for resource A. However, if resource B has a dependency on resource C, resource C is not included in the list of dependencies for resource A. An application can recursively call each ResourceNodeReader dependency list, but care must be taken for circular dependencies to avoid a code-deadlock. E.g. if resource A has resource B as a dependency, but resource B has resource A as a dependency, there is a circular dependency.

member.exception: In ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false if there is an invalid node.

member.summary: Returns the complete xml:base associated with this item. "Complete" means that the xml:base is computed relative to the parent <resources> xml:base and its parent <manifest> xml:base.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.FileNodeReader.Location
member.summary: The location of this file. If the path is relative, then the file is within the package. If the path is an absolute URL, then the file is not included in the package.
member.remarks:
If the <file>/href is relative, this value is built relative to the xml:base attributes on the <manifest>, <resources>, and <resource> nodes.
If the href attribute does not exist on the <file> node, and parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=true, a warning is logged and the value null is returned.
The location is resolved with the xml:base attributes on the manifest, resources, and resource nodes.
member.exception: Parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false and the href attribute is absent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.FileNodeReader.Metadata
member.summary: Return a reader of the file level metadata.
member.exception: The parsing mode is ManifestReaderSettings.FixScormRequirementViolations=false and there is more than one <metadata> node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.FileNodeReader.IsEntryPoint
member.summary: True if this is the entry point of the parent <resource>. False if it is not.
member.remarks: A file is the entry point of a resource if it is "launching point" of the resource. E.g. the <file>/href attribute matches the <resource>/href attribute. Note that the <resource>/href attribute may be an external URL, and therefore no <file> will be the entry point.

member.name: T:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.MetadataNodeReader
member.summary: Represents metadata within a manifest.
member.remarks:
This class does very little error checking or parsing of metadata, and is provided to simplify obtaining the title and description of a metadata block. The first call to GetTitle or GetDescriptions will throw InvalidPackageException if the <adlcp:location> of the <metadata> points to a file that can not be obtained. Thereafter, they return String.Empty.
When obtained via a Metadata property on ManifestReader, OrganizationNodeReader, ActivityNodeReader, ResourceNodeReader, or FileNodeReader, the GetTitle is called before the MetadataNodeReader is returned. If a InvalidPackageException is thrown during this calls, it is caught and handled according to the chosen ManifestReaderSettings and package validation enforcement.
This means that any additional calls to GetTitle or GetDescriptions will return String.Empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.MetadataNodeReader.#ctor(Microsoft.LearningComponents.PackageReader,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Uri)
member.summary: Create a Metadata object.
member.param: The package that contains any metadata files that are external to the manifest. If null, this MetadataNodeReader will be unable to retrieve metadata external to the manifest.
A <metadata> node from a manifest.
The xml:base to use when constructing the location for metadata external to the manifest. Set to null if there is no xml:base.
member.remarks: There is no error checking done on the parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.MetadataNodeReader.Create(Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.Helper,Microsoft.LearningComponents.PackageReader,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Uri)
member.summary: Create a Metadata object, with error handling during creation.
member.param: Helper object used to assist error handling. If null, no error handling occurs.
The package that contains any metadata files that are external to the manifest. If null, this MetadataNodeReader will be unable to retrieve metadata external to the manifest.
A <metadata> node from a manifest.
The xml:base to use when constructing the location for metadata external to the manifest. Set to null if there is no xml:base.
member.remarks: After creating a new MetadataNodeReader using the constructor, this method then calls GetTitle, catching any InvalidPackageException that occurs. It then uses the Helper to handle the exception according to the ManifestReaderSettings and validation behavior.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.MetadataNodeReader.GetTitle
member.summary: Gets the title associated with this metadata that matches the current culture.
member.returns: The title that best matches the current culture or String.Empty if there is no title specified.
member.remarks:
Note that an InvalidPackageException may be thrown on the first call to this method. If this happens, subsequent calls do not throw additional exceptions. Instead, String.Empty is returned.
If Location is an absolute URI, this method returns String.Empty because absolute URI is not supported.
member.exception: This is the first call to this method, and the metadata is located in a metadata file that can not be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.MetadataNodeReader.GetTitle(System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Gets the general title associated with this metadata that best matches the specified culture.
member.param: The culture used to determine which title to return.
member.returns: The title that best matches the specified or String.Empty if there is no title specified.
member.remarks:
Note that an InvalidPackageException may be thrown on the first call to this method. If this happens, subsequent calls do not throw additional exceptions. Instead, String.Empty is returned.
If Location is an absolute URI, this method returns String.Empty because absolute URI is not supported.
member.exception: This is the first call to this method, and the metadata is located in a metadata file that can not be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.MetadataNodeReader.GetDescriptions
member.summary: Gets a collection of general description values that matches the current culture.
member.returns: The descriptions that best match the current culture, or an empty collection if no descriptions exist.
member.remarks:
This <description> blocks in the metadata should each contain consistent language strings, or unpredictable values may be returned from this method.
Note that an InvalidPackageException may be thrown on the first call to this method. If this happens, subsequent calls do not throw additional exceptions. Instead, an empty collection is returned.
If Location is an absolute URI, this method returns an empty collection because absolute URI is not supported.
member.exception: This is the first call to this method, and the metadata is located in a metadata file that can not be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.LearningComponents.Manifest.MetadataNodeReader.GetDescriptions(System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Gets a collection of general description values that most closely match the requested culture.
member.param: The culture used to determine which descriptions to return.
member.returns: The description that best matches the specified , or an empty collection if no descriptions exist.
member.remarks:
This <description> blocks in the metadata should each contain consistent language strings, or unpredictable values may be returned from this method.
Note that an InvalidPackageException may be thrown on the first call to this method. If this happens, subsequent calls do not throw additional exceptions. Instead, String.Empty is returned.
If Location is an absolute URI, this method returns String.Empty because absolute URI is not supported.
member.exception: This is the first call to this method, and the metadata is located in a metadata file that can not be found.

member.summary: Returns the version of scorm parsed by this reader.
